popt4jlib

Class DblArray1SparseVectorFE

  • java.lang.Object
    • popt4jlib.DblArray1SparseVectorFE
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, SparseVectorIntf, VectorIntf

    public class DblArray1SparseVectorFE
extends java.lang.Object
implements SparseVectorIntf
    sparse double[] implementation of SparseVectorIntf, maintaining two arrays, an index array, and the FULL length values array. This implementation is based on the DblArray1SparseVector class but is much faster on getCoord() operations, at the expense of (eventually huge) memory requirements. Notice also that the class is not thread-safe, just like the DblArray1SparseVector class isn't either.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getCoord

        public double getCoord(int i)
                throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        return the i-th coordinate of this VectorIntf (i must be in the set {0,1,2,...getNumCoords()-1}). Very fast access!
        Specified by:

        double

        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if i is not in the set mentioned above

      • setCoord

        public void setCoord(int i,
            double val)
              throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        set the i-th coordinate of this VectorIntf (i must be in the set {0,1,2,...getNumCoords()-1}). Repeated calls to this method for indices not in the original contruction of this vector will eventually destroy its sparsity. Has O(_ilen) worst-case time-complexity where _ilen is the (max.) number of non-zeros in the array. The time-complexity reduces to O(log(_ilen)) if the element to be set, is already non-zero before the operation.
        Specified by:
        setCoord in interface VectorIntf
        Parameters:
        i - int
        val - double
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if i is not in the set mentioned above
